result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard K. Fibish Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
-------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

defendant.name: Fibish, Richard K., Jr.
defendant.address: 909 N. Church St Apt 102, Elkhorn, WI 53121

records.addlTxt: Application for Jail Time Credit form
Prisoner Release Form filed.
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Richard K. Fibish Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Richard K. Fibish Jr. Called @ 4:0 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for free to argue sentencing on both files - 21CF253 & 22CF149. Parties have no agreements.
4:03 p.m. - Argument by Atty. Herrmann
4:07 p.m. - Argument by Atty. Venema
4:13 p.m. - Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
4:14 p.m. - Record by the Court as to sentencing factors.
Court order the following sentence:
21CF253 - 
Count #1 -  Sentence Withheld - Three (3) Years Probation -  Sentenced to Drug Court
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
One (1) year conditional jail time STAYED for use by drug court for violations.
Pay Drug Treatment Court fees in the amount of $500.00
No drugs or drug paraphernalia. No prescription medications without valid prescription and must be taken within prescribed limits.
Not to be in the company of any known drug users or dealers
No contact with any Walmart stores. No contact with Mobile Mart
Obtain and maintain full time employment or school, or combination of both. 
Counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Must enter into and successfully complete the Walworth County Drug Court Program, and comply with all rules, recommendations, requirements, and fess of the program.
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Probation may terminate early upon successful completion of Drug Court. 
REMAINING COUNTS:  Costs and DNA sample and surcharge.

On 22CF149 - Costs on each count and DNA Sample and surcharge.

Court signs prisoner release form, and defendant ordered to appear at Drug Court on Thursday, August 18th. 
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.

Defendant Richard K. Fibish Jr. in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Richard K. Fibish Jr. Called @ 3:10 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea hearing. Record by Atty. Venema who responds to Court's questions as to plea and free to argue sentencing. Court goes over maximum penalties, deportation warnings with the defendant. Defendant responds to Court's questions as to plea questionnaire. Atty. Venema responds to Court's questions regarding plea and stipulation to facts. 
Defendant pleads GUILTY to all counts in both files. Court finds pleas to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent and finds defendant guilty.
Record by the State who is asking for PSI as they may be requesting prison. Response by Atty. Venema who is not asking for PSI and believes criminal record can be argued by the State at sentencing. Atty. TenHaken responds to further questions of the Court as to criminal history. Based upon record, Court finds PSI is not necessary and sets both matters over for sentencing. Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea hearing on August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter Requesting Plea and Sentencing Date
Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Reddy after August 1, 2022.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

3:01 PM Defendant Richard K. Fibish Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Richard K. Fibish Jr. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Venema acknowledges the receipt of the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Need Judge assigned then set for Status Hearing.

Adj. 3:04PM
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Authorization to Appear and Act

Defendant Richard K. Fibish Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Richard K. Fibish Jr. Called @ 3:05 pm. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance on 22CF149 and status hearing on 21CF253. Record by Atty. Venema who was just retained on both matters. Atty. waives reading of complaint and requests preliminary hearing on new file within time limits with pending file to track. Defendant waives speedy preliminary hearing to the date given. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Called @ 3:25 p.m. Appearances made. Defendant in court in custody by video.  Andrew Herrmann for the State and Leah Selmek for the defendant. Discussion as to bond. Court sets total bond on both files - 21CF253 & 22CF149.  BB1, BB4 and No contact with Mobil Mart in Delavan WI.  Court sets matter out for about 45 days at Atty. Selmek's request. Minutes filed.

BOND TO COVER 22CF149 & 21CF253

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DELAVAN MOBILE MART. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Deft in custody on warrant

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard K. Fibish Jr. not in court.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Richard K. Fibish Jr. Defendant is in custody in Kenosha County. Warrant to issue. Minutes filed.
